text: The New York State Assembly is the lower house of the New York State Legislature, the New York State Senate being the upper house. There are 150 seats in the Assembly. Assembly members serve two-year terms with no term limits. The Assembly meets at the State Capitol in Albany. It is currently controlled by the Democratic Party. ==Leadership== Position Name Party District Speaker Carl Heastie Democratic 83 Majority Leader Crystal Peoples- Stokes Democratic 141 Minority Leader William Barclay Republican 120 ==Composition== The Assembly has been controlled by the Democratic Party since 1975. As of October 2020, the Democrats hold 101 of the Assembly's 150 seats.
